subject: Fast and slow tests
msgSnippet: Integration and unit tests are actually not mutually exclusive with fast and slow tests.  Here is an example: @Test(groups = { fast , unit }) public void
messageBody:
Integration and unit tests are actually not mutually exclusive with fast and
slow tests. Here is an example:

@Test(groups = {"fast", "unit"})
public void fullName() {
Person p = new Person();
p.setFirstName("Cedric");
p.setLastName("Beust");
assert "Cedric Beust".equals(p.getFullName());
}

@Test(groups = {"slow", "unit"}}
public void verifyPi() {
Pi pi = new Pi();
assert pi.getDecimals(10000).equals(EXPECTED_DECIMALS);
}

@Test(groups = {"fast", "integration"})
public void tableShouldExist() {
// verify that a table exists
}

@Test(groups = {"slow", "integration"})
public void insertGraphOfObjects() {
// insert a lot of rows in the database
}

With this set up, I have all freedom to run "integration", "unit", "fast" or
"slow" tests.

This is why trying to represent test groups with packages and class names
doesn't scale: test methods cannot belong to more than one group with that
approach.

--
Cédric
